item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Michael Pollan
item.description: "You are what what you eat eats." -- Michael Pollan

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Why do they always teach us that it's easy and evil to do what we want and that we need discipline to restrain ourselves? It's the hardest thing in the world--to do what we want. And it takes the greatest kind of courage. I mean, what we really want." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Michael Pollan
item.description: "Eat food. Not too much. Mostly plants." -- Michael Pollan

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Joanne Harris
item.description: "A few hundred years ago there were no differences between magic and medicine." -- Joanne Harris

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Contradictions do not exist. Whenever you think that you are facing a contradiction, check your premises. You will find that one of them is wrong." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Joy is the goal of existence, and joy is not to be stumbled upon, but to be achieved, and the act of treason is to let its vision drown in the swamp of the moment's torture." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by The Dalai Lama
item.description: "Know the rules well, so you can break them effectively." -- The Dalai Lama

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Only then does he realize what he has done to Mirabelle, how wanting a square inch of her and not all of her has damaged them both, and how he cannot justify his actions except that, well, it was life." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "It was time to take the pumpkin out of the pot and eat it. In the final analysis, that was what solved these big problems of life. You could think and think and get nowhere, but you still had to eat your pumpkin. That brought you down to earth. That gave you a reason for going on. Pumpkin." -- Alexander McCall Smith

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "She has learned that her body is precious and it mustn't be offered carelessly ever again, as it holds a direct connection to her heart." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Time -- when pursued like a bandit -- will behave like one; always remaining one country or one room ahead of you, changing its name and hair color to elude you, slipping ou the back door of the motel just as you're banging through the lobby with your newest search warrant, leaving only a burning cigarette in the ashtray to taunt you." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I think you have every right to cherry-pick when it comes to moving your spirit and finding peace in God. You take whatever works from wherever you can find it, and you keep moving toward the light." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The hardest thing to explain is the glaringly evident which everybody has decided not to see." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "To say "I love you" one must know first how to say the "I"." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Michael Pollan
item.description: "Don't eat anything your great-grandmother wouldn't recognize as food." -- Michael Pollan

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Edward Eager
item.description:
"The best kind of book," said Barnaby, "is a magic book."
"Naturally," said John." -- Edward Eager

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." -- Aristotle

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Catherine Marshall
item.description: "Some of what I wrote bordered on blasphemy....If there was a God, He would have to be truth. And in that case, candor--however impertinent--would be more pleasing to Him than posturing." -- Catherine Marshall

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Joanne Harris
item.description: "Drunkeness, she told us in a rare moment of confidence, is a sin against the fruit, the tree, the wine itself. Wine, distilled and nurtured from bud into fruit; it deserves reverance. Joy. Gentleness. (Page 194.)" -- Joanne Harris

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Nancy E. Turner
item.description: "Sometimes I feel like a tree on a hill, at the place where all the wind blows and the hail hits the tree the hardest. All the people I love are down the side aways, sheltered under a great rock, and I am out of the fold, standing alone in the sun and the snow. I feel like I am not part of the rest somehow, although they welcome me and are kind. I see my family as they sit together and it is like theyh ave a certain way between them that is beyond me. I wonder if other folks ever feel included yet alone." -- Nancy E. Turner

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ayn Rand
Elizabeth add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Reason is not automatic. Those who deny it cannot be conquered by it. Do not count on them. Leave them alone." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "It's pain that changes our lives." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "He who controls the past controls the future. He who controls the present controls the past." -- George Orwell

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "If you want a picture of the future, imagine a boot stamping on a human face—for ever." -- George Orwell

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "I like being myself. Myself and nasty." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin." -- Aldous Huxley
